name: APCSP - Explore
description: APCSP - Explore

name: APCSP - Exam
rules: You must have validated h2s-apcsp-create and h2s-apcsp-explore. You should have validated h2s-ap-vocabulary
description: APCSP - Exam

name: A Room of One's Own
description: Write a static HTML & CSS website.

name: WireFrame
description: H2S - WireFrame

name: 42stagram
description: Write an Instagram clone in Ruby on Rails or Python with Django.

name: First Day
description: Setup, peer correction, and terminal navigation.

name: Hacker, baby
rules: You should have validated h2s-first-day and h2s-information-libre. You should not have validated h2s-intro-sequence
description: H2S - Litmus test for language command

name: Internet Simulator
description: As a class, we will work through Code.org's Internet Simulator exercises. They are a fun way to relive the challenges that early internet developers had to solve in order to create the web as we know it today.

name: A Night at the Bar
description: Create an interactive web page using Ruby with Sinatra or Python with Flask.

name: Information Libre
rules: You should have validated h2s-first-day. You should not have validated h2s-intro-sequence
description: Information Libre is a set of seven challenges covering the essential building blocks that you need to write programs in any programming language. We recommend that you follow along in an open source tutorial to read about each concept.

name: Cryptography
description: In this beginner cryptography project you are challenged to encode, decode, and try to crack the Ceaser and Vignere ciphers.

name: SonicPi
description: Sonic Pi is a nice library that you can you to synthesize audio tracks. Make something with it, either a remix or an original composition.

name: Game Of Life
description: The Game of Life is a famous and mind-blowing computer science exercise. Code a command-line version for basic points, or, an colorful interactive version using the graphics library from Processing.org.

name: Hangman
description: Code a command-line version of the game Hangman. You'll need to figure out how to read the dictionary.

name: Fractal
rules: You must have validated h2s-hacker-baby. You should have validated graphics-game-of-life
description: Create an interactive Julia set fractal using the Processing.org graphics library.

name: Connect-4
description: Code Connect 4 on the command line.

name: Talk
rules: You should have validated h2s-first-day. You should not have validated h2s-information-libre

name: Walk
rules: You should have validated h2s-first-day and h2s-intro-sequence-talk

name: Write
rules: You should have validated h2s-first-day, h2s-intro-sequence-talk, and h2s-intro-sequence-walk. You should not have validated h2s-information-libre

name: Command-Line Games
description: This is a parent project for all types of games you can write to be played directly in the Terminal. We have three of them in PDF form: Tic Tac Toe (with some more guidance for beginners), Hangman, and Connect 4. You can also get credit for a command line implementation of another game if you prefer to chose your own!

name: Graphics with Processing
description: This is the parent project for some things you can do with the Processing graphics library. You can write code for Processing in Python, Java, Ruby, or Javascript. Take a look - processing.org.

name: Collaborate
description: This project will be a set of exercises which help us learn how to use Git commands properly to share your code with others and split up your effort on a large project. It is still under construction - come back and complete this one when it's ready!

name: Tic Tac Toe
description: Code Tic Tac Toe in the command line. This is a good beginner project, and the PDF offers a little bit more guidance about how to start building your project.
